_header: Victorious King our lord full gracious
_description: Thomas Hoccleve (?), Virelai to Henry V for money — three 8-line stanzas of which the third is an envoy

BodFair16.First Lines:
Victoriouse kyng oure lorde moste graciouseWe humble legemen to
                    youre highnesse…
BodFair16.Last Lines:
…lat nat the strook of Indigence vs mateExcellent prince
                    Mirour of prowesse
BodFair16.Facsimiles:
Norton-Smith,  John. 
             “Introduction.” 
             Bodleian Library MS Fairfax 16.
         London: Scolar Press, 1979.

HunHM111.First Lines:
Victorious kyng our lord ful graciousWe humble lige men to your
                    hynesse…
HunHM111.Last Lines:
…Lat nat the strook of indigence vs mateO worthy Prince mirour
                    of prowesse
HunHM111.Attributed Title: Item au Roy que dieu pardoint (f. 40)
